title: Alex Raymond
summary: Alexander Gillespie Raymond Jr. (October 2, 1909 â€“ September 6, 1956)[2] was an American cartoonist who was best known for creating the Flash Gordon comic strip for King Features Syndicate in 1934. The strip was subsequently adapted into many other media, from three Universal movie serials (1936's Flash Gordon, 1938's Flash Gordon's Trip to Mars, and 1940's Flash Gordon Conquers the Universe) to a 1970s television series and a 1980 feature film.
